page.title: 19Around Camphill
page.content: Camphill is an ancient settlement and the remains of an old fort can be found to the rear of our school.Today many people live and work in the area.The main sewage processing plant for the whole of Ballymena lies approximately one kilometre from the school. A new cemetery has recently been consecrated in our neighbourhood for the use of the whole community.The area has many churches and schools which supply the needs of the people.A state children's home is situated close by,and provides a home for between twenty and thirty children,who are less fortunate than ourselves.These children can live in the home for peiods of time ranging from a few weeks to a number of years.Some of the children soon return to their own homes and others are looked after by foster parents.
